# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    line_length = 0
    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
        line_length += length(word)
    end
    return result
end
```
Here's an example of usage:
```julia
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```
The output would be:
```julia
"This function 
will wrap words 
into lines"
```
